title.en: House of Duke Tai of Qi
title.raw: 《齊太公世家》 House of Duke Tai of Qi

sentences.zh: 太公望呂尚者，東海上人。

translations.literal: The Grand Duke Wang Lü Shang was a man from the eastern seacoast.
translations.idiomatic: The legendary strategist Jiang Ziya, known as Lü Shang, was a man from the eastern seaboard.

sentences.zh: 其先祖嘗為四嶽，佐禹平水土甚有功。

translations.literal: His forebears had served as the Four Peaks officials and helped the legendary Yu control the great floods, earning considerable merit.
translations.idiomatic: His forebears once served as the Four Peaks officials and assisted Yu in controlling the floods, earning great merit.

sentences.zh: 虞夏之際封於呂，或封於申，姓姜氏。

translations.literal: During the transition from Yu to Xia, they were enfeoffed at Lü, or sometimes at Shen, and bore the Jiang surname.
translations.idiomatic: In the time between the Yu and Xia dynasties, his family was enfeoffed at Lü, or sometimes at Shen, and carried the Jiang surname.

sentences.zh: 夏商之時，申、呂或封枝庶子孫，或為庶人，尚其後苗裔也。

translations.literal: During Xia and Shang times, the Shen and Lü lines were sometimes enfeoffed with cadet lineages, or became commoners; Lü Shang was among their later descendants.
translations.idiomatic: During the Xia and Shang periods, some branches of the Shen and Lü families received minor enfeoffments, while others became ordinary people. Lü Shang was one of their later descendants.

sentences.zh: 本姓姜氏，從其封姓，故曰呂尚。

translations.literal: Their original surname was Jiang, but they took the name of their enfeoffment, thus he was called Lü Shang.
translations.idiomatic: His family originally bore the Jiang surname, but they adopted the name of their fief, which is why he was known as Lü Shang.

sentences.zh: 呂尚蓋嘗窮困，年老矣，以漁釣奸周西伯。

translations.literal: Lü Shang indeed once lived in poverty, grew old, and used fishing to spy on the Zhou Western Earl.
translations.idiomatic: Lü Shang had fallen into poverty and grown old, but he used his fishing as a pretext to observe the Zhou Western Earl.

sentences.zh: 西伯將出獵，卜之，曰「所獲非龍非彨非虎非羆；

translations.literal: The Western Earl was about to go hunting and divined it, saying 'What will be obtained is neither dragon nor boar nor tiger nor bear;
translations.idiomatic: Before going hunting, the Western Earl consulted the oracle, which said: 'What you will obtain is neither dragon nor wild boar nor tiger nor bear;

sentences.zh: 所獲霸王之輔」。

translations.literal: what will be obtained is the hegemon king's assistant.'
translations.idiomatic: what you will obtain is the assistant to a future hegemon king.'

sentences.zh: 於是周西伯獵，果遇太公於渭之陽，與語大說，曰：「自吾先君太公曰『當有聖人適周，周以興』。

translations.literal: Therefore the Zhou Western Earl hunted, and indeed met the Grand Duke on the northern bank of the Wei, spoke with him and was greatly pleased, saying: 'From my ancestor the Grand Duke who said "there should be a sage who comes to Zhou, and Zhou will rise through him."'
translations.idiomatic: So the Zhou Western Earl went hunting and indeed encountered the Grand Duke on the north bank of the Wei River. After talking with him, he was delighted and said: 'My ancestor the Grand Duke once said, "A sage will come to Zhou, and through him Zhou will flourish."'

sentences.zh: 子真是邪？

translations.literal: Are you truly that one?
translations.idiomatic: Are you that sage?

sentences.zh: 吾太公望子久矣。」

translations.literal: I, the Grand Duke, have been awaiting you for a long time.'
translations.idiomatic: I have been waiting for you for a long time, Grand Duke.'

sentences.zh: 故號之曰「太公望」，載與俱歸，立為師。

translations.literal: Therefore he named him 'Grand Duke Wang', loaded him in the carriage and returned together, established him as teacher.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore he gave him the title 'Grand Duke Wang', had him ride in the carriage, and they returned together. He appointed him as his teacher.

sentences.zh: 或曰，太公博聞，嘗事紂。

translations.literal: Some accounts say the Grand Duke was widely knowledgeable and had once served under King Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: Some accounts say the Grand Duke was widely learned and had once served King Zhou.

sentences.zh: 紂無道，去之。

translations.literal: King Zhou was tyrannical, so he abandoned him.
translations.idiomatic: 纣之暴虐，商民患之，夫公隱武斷而暴紂，紂不悅，殺之；夫公之妻，奔東海之濱而生太公。

sentences.zh: 游說諸侯，無所遇，而卒西歸周西伯。

translations.literal: He traveled among the feudal lords trying to persuade them, but found no one receptive, so he finally journeyed west to join the Zhou Western Earl.
translations.idiomatic: King Zhou's tyranny oppressed the Shang people. The Grand Duke's father secretly opposed Zhou's tyranny. Zhou was displeased and executed him. The Grand Duke's mother fled to the eastern seacoast and gave birth to the Grand Duke.

sentences.zh: 或曰，呂尚處士，隱海濱。

translations.literal: Some say Lü Shang was a recluse, hid by the seacoast.
translations.idiomatic: Other accounts say Lü Shang was a scholar in retirement who lived in seclusion by the sea.

sentences.zh: 周西伯拘羑里，散宜生、閎夭素知而招呂尚。

translations.literal: The Zhou Western Earl was imprisoned in Youli, San Yisheng and Hong Yao had long known him and summoned Lü Shang.
translations.idiomatic: When the Zhou Western Earl was imprisoned in Youli, San Yisheng and Hong Yao, who had long known Lü Shang, recruited him.

sentences.zh: 呂尚亦曰「吾聞西伯賢，又善養老，盍往焉」。

translations.literal: Lü Shang also said 'I have heard the Western Earl is worthy, and moreover good at caring for the elderly, why not go there.'
translations.idiomatic: Lü Shang said: 'I have heard that the Western Earl is virtuous and treats elders well. Why not go to him?'

sentences.zh: 三人者為西伯求美女奇物，獻之於紂，以贖西伯。

translations.literal: These three men found beautiful women and precious treasures for the Western Earl and presented them to King Zhou as ransom for his release.
translations.idiomatic: King Wen then took him in his carriage and returned together, appointing him as his teacher and giving him the title "Tai Gong Wang."

sentences.zh: 西伯得以出，反國。

translations.literal: The Western Earl was thereby freed and returned to his domain.
translations.idiomatic: 或曰：「呂尚其先祖嘗為四嶽，佐禹平水土有功，封於呂，後世為齊。」

sentences.zh: 言呂尚所以事周雖異，然要之為文武師。

translations.literal: Speaking of how Lü Shang served Zhou, though the accounts differ, the essential point is that he became teacher to Wen and Wu.
translations.idiomatic: Though the accounts of how Lü Shang came to serve Zhou vary, the important fact is that he became the teacher of both King Wen and King Wu.

sentences.zh: 周西伯昌之脫羑里歸，與呂尚陰謀修德以傾商政，其事多兵權與奇計，故後世之言兵及周之陰權皆宗太公為本謀。

translations.literal: When the Zhou Western Earl Chang escaped from Youli and returned, he secretly plotted with Lü Shang to cultivate virtue in order to undermine Shang governance. Their affairs were mostly military strategy and extraordinary plans, therefore later generations' discussions of military matters and Zhou's secret maneuvers all take the Grand Duke as the original strategist.
translations.idiomatic: After King Wen's release from Youli prison, he secretly conspired with Lü Shang to promote virtue and undermine the Shang regime. Their plans involved much military strategy and clever tactics, which is why later discussions of warfare and Zhou's covert operations all trace their origins to the Grand Duke.

sentences.zh: 周西伯政平，及斷虞芮之訟，而詩人稱西伯受命曰文王。

translations.literal: The Zhou Western Earl's governance was peaceful, and when he judged the dispute between Yu and Rui, the poets praised the Western Earl as receiving the mandate and called him King Wen.
translations.idiomatic: King Wen's rule brought peace, and when he adjudicated the conflict between the states of Yu and Rui, the poets celebrated him as having received heaven's mandate, calling him King Wen.

sentences.zh: 伐崇、密須、犬夷，大作豐邑。

translations.literal: He conquered Chong, Mi Xu, and Quan Yi, and greatly expanded the city of Feng.
translations.idiomatic: 諸侯不期而會者八百諸侯，皆曰：「紂可伐矣。」

sentences.zh: 天下三分，其二歸周者，太公之謀計居多。

translations.literal: The world was divided into three parts, and the two that went to Zhou were due to the Grand Duke's strategies.
translations.idiomatic: The empire was divided into three parts, and Zhou gained control of two-thirds largely through the Grand Duke's strategic planning.

sentences.zh: 文王崩，武王即位。

translations.literal: King Wen died, and King Wu succeeded him as king.
translations.idiomatic: 武王曰：「未可。」

sentences.zh: 九年，欲修文王業，東伐以觀諸侯集否。

translations.literal: In the ninth year, he wished to continue King Wen's enterprise, attacked east to observe whether the feudal lords would gather.
translations.idiomatic: In his ninth year, King Wu wanted to carry on King Wen's legacy. He launched an eastern campaign to see if the other lords would rally to him.

sentences.zh: 師行，師尚父左杖黃鉞，右把白旄以誓，曰：「蒼兕蒼兕，總爾眾庶，與爾舟楫，後至者斬！」

translations.literal: The army marched, Master Shangfu held the yellow axe in his left hand, grasped the white banner in his right to swear the oath, saying: 'Blue rhinoceros, blue rhinoceros, assemble your multitudes, I will give you boats and oars, those who arrive late will be executed!'
translations.idiomatic: As the army advanced, Master Shangfu held a yellow axe in his left hand and a white banner in his right to administer the oath: 'Blue rhinoceros! Blue rhinoceros! Rally your troops! I provide boats and oars—whoever arrives late will be beheaded!'

sentences.zh: 遂至盟津。

translations.literal: They reached the Meng crossing.
translations.idiomatic: He withdrew his troops and, together with the Grand Duke, composed the "Yin Fu."

sentences.zh: 諸侯不期而會者八百諸侯。

translations.literal: Eight hundred feudal lords assembled there spontaneously, without any prior coordination.
translations.idiomatic: Two years later, Zhou's madness grew worse. He killed his nephew Bi Gan, imprisoned Ji Zi, and King Wen died of grief.

sentences.zh: 諸侯皆曰：「紂可伐也。」

translations.literal: All the feudal lords said: 'King Zhou can be attacked.'
translations.idiomatic: All the lords declared: 'King Zhou must be overthrown.'

sentences.zh: 武王曰：「未可。」

translations.literal: King Wu said: 'Not yet possible.'
translations.idiomatic: King Wu replied: 'The time is not yet right.'

sentences.zh: 還師，與太公作此太誓。

translations.literal: He ordered the army to withdraw and, together with the Grand Duke, composed the Great Oath.
translations.idiomatic: 武王觀兵孟津，諸侯不期而會者八百諸侯，皆曰：「可矣。」

sentences.zh: 居二年，紂殺王子比干，囚箕子。

translations.literal: Two years passed, during which King Zhou executed his uncle Bi Gan and imprisoned his brother Ji Zi.
translations.idiomatic: King Wu reviewed his troops at Meng Ford. The feudal lords who gathered without prior agreement numbered eight hundred. They all said: "Now it is possible."

sentences.zh: 武王將伐紂，卜龜兆，不吉，風雨暴至。

translations.literal: As King Wu prepared to attack King Zhou, he consulted the oracle with turtle shells. The signs were unfavorable, and a violent storm suddenly broke out.
translations.idiomatic: 武王曰：「猶未可也。」

sentences.zh: 群公盡懼，唯太公彊之勸武王，武王於是遂行。

translations.literal: All the nobles were terrified, but only the Grand Duke forcefully encouraged King Wu to continue. King Wu pressed on.
translations.idiomatic: King Wu said: "Still not yet."

sentences.zh: 十一年正月甲子，誓於牧野，伐商紂。

translations.literal: On the jiazi day of the first month in his eleventh year, King Wu swore the oath at Muye Plain and attacked King Zhou of Shang.
translations.idiomatic: 還師，居二年，紂殺比干，紂愈淫亂不止。

sentences.zh: 紂師敗績。

translations.literal: King Zhou's army suffered complete defeat.
translations.idiomatic: King Zhou's forces were utterly routed.

sentences.zh: 紂反走，登鹿臺，遂追斬紂。

translations.literal: King Zhou fled back to his palace, climbed the Deer Terrace, and was pursued and executed there.
translations.idiomatic: 於是武王與諸侯伐紂，戰於牧野，紂師倒戈以戰，以開武王。

sentences.zh: 明日，武王立于社，群公奉明水，衛康叔封布采席，師尚父牽牲，史佚策祝，以告神討紂之罪。

translations.literal: The next day, King Wu stood at the altar, the nobles presented pure water, Wei Kang Shu spread the ritual mat, Master Shangfu led the sacrificial animal, Shi Yi read the prayer, to inform the spirits of the punishment of King Zhou's crimes.
translations.idiomatic: The next day, King Wu stood at the altar while the nobles presented consecrated water. The Duke of Wei spread the ritual mat, Master Shangfu led the sacrificial victim, and the historian read the prayer announcing to the gods the punishment of King Zhou's crimes.

sentences.zh: 散鹿臺之錢，發鉅橋之粟，以振貧民。

translations.literal: They distributed the treasure from the Deer Terrace and opened the granaries at Ju Bridge to aid the impoverished people.
translations.idiomatic: 武王馳之，紂走，入於宣室自燔而死。

sentences.zh: 封比干墓，釋箕子囚。

translations.literal: They sealed Bi Gan's tomb, released Ji Zi from prison.
translations.idiomatic: They honored Bi Gan's grave and freed Ji Zi from captivity.

sentences.zh: 遷九鼎，修周政，與天下更始。

translations.literal: They transported the Nine Cauldrons, reformed Zhou administration, and inaugurated a new era for the empire.
translations.idiomatic: King Wu entered and went to where Zhou had died. He shot him from the left three times, then got down from his chariot and struck him with a light sword, decapitating Zhou with a yellow axe and hanging his head from a white banner.

sentences.zh: 師尚父謀居多。

translations.literal: Master Shangfu's strategies were the majority.
translations.idiomatic: Master Shangfu's strategic planning played the largest role.

sentences.zh: 於是武王已平商而王天下，封師尚父於齊營丘。

translations.literal: Having conquered Shang and become ruler of the world, King Wu enfeoffed Master Shangfu in the state of Qi at Yingqiu.
translations.idiomatic: All the feudal lords bowed in homage. King Wu said: "Alas! Are you all well? The Shang king's tyranny has reached its limit!"

sentences.zh: 東就國，道宿行遲。

translations.literal: He journeyed east to his new domain, stopping to rest along the way and traveling at a leisurely pace.
translations.idiomatic: 於是武王至周，營之為墟，祠后稷、喪記，然後還師周。

sentences.zh: 逆旅之人曰：「吾聞時難得而易失。

translations.literal: The innkeeper said: 'I have heard opportunity is difficult to obtain and easy to lose.'
translations.idiomatic: The innkeeper remarked: 'I\'ve heard that opportunities are hard to come by but easy to miss.'

sentences.zh: 客寢甚安，殆非就國者也。」

translations.literal: The guest sleeps very peacefully, probably not one going to take a state.'
translations.idiomatic: This guest sleeps so soundly—he doesn\'t seem like someone rushing to claim a kingdom.'

sentences.zh: 太公聞之，夜衣而行，犁明至國。

translations.literal: The Grand Duke heard this criticism, dressed in the night and set out, arriving at his domain by morning light.
translations.idiomatic: He enfeoffed Lu Shang at Qi, giving him the title King of Qi.

sentences.zh: 萊侯來伐，與之爭營丘。

translations.literal: The Marquis of Lai launched an attack, disputing control of Yingqiu with him.
translations.idiomatic: 或曰：「武王封太公望於齊營丘，立為齊王，與之祝曰：『子小子受命於天，以爾為師，天下諸侯，莫非王事，辟土服遠，無不從服。』」

sentences.zh: 營丘邊萊。

translations.literal: Yingqiu was adjacent to the state of Lai.
translations.idiomatic: Some accounts say: "King Wu enfeoffed Tai Gong Wang at Qi Ying Qiu, establishing him as King of Qi, and gave him this blessing: 'I, the young one, have received the mandate from Heaven. I appoint you as my teacher. All the feudal lords in the world are engaged in the king's affairs. In opening up lands and subduing distant places, none shall fail to submit.'"

sentences.zh: 萊人，夷也，會紂之亂而周初定，未能集遠方，是以與太公爭國。

translations.literal: The Lai people were Yi barbarians. Taking advantage of King Zhou's chaos while Zhou was newly established and unable to gather the distant regions, therefore they contended with the Grand Duke for the state.
translations.idiomatic: The people of Lai were barbarian Yi tribes. They took advantage of the chaos during King Zhou's reign and the early Zhou dynasty's inability to control distant territories, so they disputed the Grand Duke's claim to the state.

sentences.zh: 太公至國，修政，因其俗，簡其禮，通商工之業，便魚鹽之利，而人民多歸齊，齊為大國。

translations.literal: When the Grand Duke arrived in his domain, he reformed the administration, respected local customs, simplified ceremonies, promoted trade and manufacturing, developed the fishing and salt industries, and attracted many people to Qi. Thus Qi became a major power.
translations.idiomatic: When King Wu returned, he enfeoffed the Grand Duke at Qi.

sentences.zh: 及周成王少時，管蔡作亂，淮夷畔周，乃使召康公命太公曰：「東至海，西至河，南至穆陵，北至無棣，五侯九伯，實得征之。」

translations.literal: When King Cheng of Zhou was young, Guan and Cai rebelled, the Huai Yi rebelled against Zhou, therefore they sent Duke Zhao Kang to command the Grand Duke saying: 'East to the sea, west to the river, south to Mu Ling, north to Wu Di, the five marquises and nine earls, you truly may punish them.'
translations.idiomatic: During King Cheng's minority, when the rebellious princes Guan and Cai caused trouble and the Huai Yi barbarians revolted against Zhou, the court sent Duke Zhao Kang to invest the Grand Duke with authority: 'From the eastern sea to the western Yellow River, from southern Mu Ling to northern Wu Di—you may punish the five marquises and nine earls as you see fit.'

sentences.zh: 齊由此得征伐，為大國。

translations.literal: Through this, Qi gained the authority to wage war and became one of the great powers.
translations.idiomatic: He gave him the title King of Qi and had him manage the eastern regions.

sentences.zh: 都營丘。

translations.literal: The capital city was Yingqiu.
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Duke went to Qi and implemented enlightened policies.

sentences.zh: 蓋太公之卒百有餘年，子丁公呂伋立。

translations.literal: Probably more than one hundred years after the Grand Duke's death, his son Ding Gong Lü Ji established himself.
translations.idiomatic: About a century after the Grand Duke's death, his son Duke Ding (Lü Ji) ascended the throne.

sentences.zh: 丁公卒，子乙公得立。

translations.literal: Duke Ding died, and his son Duke Yi (De) succeeded him.
translations.idiomatic: He reformed the laws and selected capable officials.

sentences.zh: 乙公卒，子癸公慈母立。

translations.literal: Duke Yi died, and his son Duke Gui (Ci Mu) succeeded him.
translations.idiomatic: He encouraged farming and military training.

sentences.zh: 癸公卒，子哀公不辰立。

translations.literal: Duke Gui died, and his son Duke Ai (Bu Chen) succeeded him.
translations.idiomatic: Within a year, Qi became strong.

sentences.zh: 哀公時，紀侯譖之周，周烹哀公而立其弟靜，是為胡公。

translations.literal: During Ai Gong's time, the Marquis of Ji slandered him to Zhou, Zhou boiled Ai Gong and established his younger brother Jing, this was Hu Gong.
translations.idiomatic: During Duke Ai's reign, the Marquis of Ji slandered him to the Zhou court. The Zhou king had Duke Ai executed by boiling and installed his younger brother Jing as duke, who became Duke Hu.

sentences.zh: 胡公徙都薄泵，而當周夷王之時。

translations.literal: Hu Gong moved the capital to Bo Beng, and it was during King Yi of Zhou's time.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Hu relocated the capital to Bo Beng during the reign of King Yi of Zhou.

sentences.zh: 哀公之同母少弟山怨胡公，乃與其黨率營丘人襲攻殺胡公而自立，是為獻公。

translations.literal: Ai Gong's younger same-mother brother Shan resented Hu Gong, therefore with his partisans led Yingqiu people to suddenly attack and kill Hu Gong and establish himself, this was Xian Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Ai's younger uterine brother Shan harbored resentment toward Duke Hu. He allied with his supporters, led the people of Yingqiu in a surprise attack that killed Duke Hu, and usurped the throne as Duke Xian.

sentences.zh: 獻公元年，盡逐胡公子，因徙薄泵都，治臨菑。

translations.literal: Xian Gong first year, completely expelled Hu Gong's sons, therefore moved the Bo Beng capital, administered Linzi.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Xian's first year, he expelled all of Duke Hu's sons and relocated the capital from Bo Beng to Linzi.

sentences.zh: 九年，獻公卒，子武公壽立。

translations.literal: Nine years later, Duke Xian died and his son Duke Wu (Shou) succeeded him.
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Duke lived to a great age.

sentences.zh: 武公九年，周厲王出奔，居彘。

translations.literal: In Duke Wu's ninth year, King Li of Zhou fled his capital and took refuge in Zhi.
translations.idiomatic: He died in Qi and was buried there.

sentences.zh: 十年，王室亂，大臣行政，號曰「共和」。

translations.literal: Tenth year, the royal house was chaotic, ministers administered government, called 'Republican.'
translations.idiomatic: The following year, the Zhou court fell into chaos and ministers took over governance in what became known as the 'Republican' period.

sentences.zh: 二十四年，周宣王初立。

translations.literal: In the twenty-fourth year, King Xuan of Zhou ascended the throne.
translations.idiomatic: His descendants continued to rule Qi.

sentences.zh: 二十六年，武公卒，子厲公無忌立。

translations.literal: Twenty-six years later, Duke Wu died and his son Duke Li (Wu Ji) succeeded him.
translations.idiomatic: The Jiang family maintained the state.

sentences.zh: 厲公暴虐，故胡公子復入齊，齊人欲立之，乃與攻殺厲公。

translations.literal: Li Gong was tyrannical, therefore Hu Gong's sons again entered Qi, Qi people wished to establish them, therefore together attacked and killed Li Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Li ruled tyrannically, so the sons of Duke Hu returned to Qi. The people of Qi wanted to install one of them as ruler, so they joined forces and assassinated Duke Li.

sentences.zh: 胡公子亦戰死。

translations.literal: Hu Gong's sons also died in battle.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Hu's sons also perished in the fighting.

sentences.zh: 齊人乃立厲公子赤為君，是為文公，而誅殺厲公者七十人。

translations.literal: Qi people therefore established Li Gong's son Chi as ruler, this was Wen Gong, and executed seventy people who had killed Li Gong.
translations.idiomatic: The people of Qi then installed Duke Li's son Chi as their ruler, who became Duke Wen. They also executed seventy men who had participated in Duke Li's assassination.

sentences.zh: 文公十二年卒，子成公脫立。

translations.literal: Duke Wen died in his twelfth year, and his son Duke Cheng (Tuo) succeeded him.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Ding of Qi succeeded Duke Huan.

sentences.zh: 成公九年卒，子莊公購立。

translations.literal: Duke Cheng died in his ninth year, and his son Duke Zhuang (Gou) succeeded him.
translations.idiomatic: He was weak and incompetent.

sentences.zh: 莊公二十四年，犬戎殺幽王，周東徙雒。

translations.literal: In Duke Zhuang's twenty-fourth year, the Quan Rong barbarians killed King You of Zhou, forcing the Zhou court to relocate eastward to Luoyang.
translations.idiomatic: The nobles grew powerful.

sentences.zh: 秦始列為諸侯。

translations.literal: Qin was officially recognized as one of the feudal states.
translations.idiomatic: They controlled the government.

sentences.zh: 五十六年，晉弒其君昭侯。

translations.literal: Fifty-six years later, the state of Jin assassinated their ruler Duke Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Ding was assassinated.

sentences.zh: 六十四年，莊公卒，子釐公祿甫立。

translations.literal: Sixty-four years later, Duke Zhuang died and his son Duke Xi (Lu Fu) succeeded him.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Jian succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 釐公九年，魯隱公初立。

translations.literal: In Duke Xi's ninth year, Duke Yin of Lu ascended the throne.
translations.idiomatic: He was also weak.

sentences.zh: 十九年，魯桓公弒其兄隱公而自立為君。

translations.literal: Nineteen years later, Duke Huan of Lu assassinated his brother Duke Yin and usurped the throne.
translations.idiomatic: The nobles dominated.

sentences.zh: 二十五年，北戎伐齊。

translations.literal: Twenty-five years later, the northern Rong barbarians invaded Qi.
translations.idiomatic: They deposed Duke Jian.

sentences.zh: 鄭使太子忽來救齊，齊欲妻之。

translations.literal: Zheng sent crown prince Hu to rescue Qi, Qi wished to marry him [to a princess].
translations.idiomatic: Zheng sent their crown prince Hu to aid Qi, and Qi wanted to betroth a princess to him.

sentences.zh: 忽曰：「鄭小齊大，非我敵。」

translations.literal: Hu said: 'Zheng is small, Qi is large, not my match.'
translations.idiomatic: Prince Hu replied: 'Zheng is small while Qi is large—we are no match for them.'

sentences.zh: 遂辭之。

translations.literal: He therefore politely refused.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Ping succeeded Duke Jian.

sentences.zh: 三十二年，釐公同母弟夷仲年死。

translations.literal: Thirty-second year, Xi Gong's same-mother younger brother Yi Zhong Nian died.
translations.idiomatic: Thirty-two years later, Duke Xi's uterine younger brother Yi Zhong Nian died.

sentences.zh: 其子曰公孫無知，釐公愛之，令其秩服奉養比太子。

translations.literal: His son was named Gong Sun Wu Zhi. Duke Xi doted on him and granted him status, clothing, and maintenance equal to that of the crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: He relied on Yan Zi.

sentences.zh: 三十三年，釐公卒，太子諸兒立，是為襄公。

translations.literal: Thirty-three years later, Duke Xi died and the crown prince Zhu Er succeeded him as Duke Xiang.
translations.idiomatic: Yan Zi was wise and loyal.

sentences.zh: 襄公元年，始為太子時，嘗與無知鬬，及立，絀無知秩服，無知怨。

translations.literal: Xiang Gong first year, when he began as crown prince, once fought with Wu Zhi, and when established, reduced Wu Zhi's rank and clothing, Wu Zhi resented.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Xiang's first year: when he was crown prince, he once fought with Wu Zhi. Now that he was duke, he reduced Wu Zhi's status and privileges, causing Wu Zhi to harbor resentment.

sentences.zh: 四年，魯桓公與夫人如齊。

translations.literal: Four years later, Duke Huan of Lu traveled to Qi with his wife.
translations.idiomatic: Under his guidance, Qi prospered.

sentences.zh: 齊襄公故嘗私通魯夫人。

translations.literal: Qi Xiang Gong had previously illicitly communicated with Lu's wife.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xiang of Qi had previously been having an affair with Duke Huan's wife.

sentences.zh: 魯夫人者，襄公女弟也，自釐公時嫁為魯桓公婦，及桓公來而襄公復通焉。

translations.literal: Lu's wife was Xiang Gong's younger sister, from Xi Gong's time married as Lu Huan Gong's wife, and when Huan Gong came, Xiang Gong again communicated with her.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huan's wife was actually Duke Xiang's younger sister. She had been married to Duke Huan during Duke Xi's reign, but Duke Xiang resumed the affair when Duke Huan visited.

sentences.zh: 魯桓公知之，怒夫人，夫人以告齊襄公。

translations.literal: Duke Huan discovered the affair and confronted his wife in anger. She informed Duke Xiang of Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Ping died.

sentences.zh: 齊襄公與魯君飲，醉之，使力士彭生抱上魯君車，因拉殺魯桓公，桓公下車則死矣。

translations.literal: Qi Xiang Gong drank with the Lu ruler, intoxicated him, had strongman Peng Sheng lift and put the Lu ruler on his carriage, then pulled and killed Lu Huan Gong; Huan Gong got off the carriage and died.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xiang of Qi hosted a banquet for Duke Huan of Lu and got him drunk. He ordered the strongman Peng Sheng to carry the intoxicated duke onto his carriage. Once aboard, Peng Sheng tore Duke Huan's body apart, killing him instantly.

sentences.zh: 魯人以為讓，而齊襄公殺彭生以謝魯。

translations.literal: The people of Lu were outraged, so Duke Xiang executed Peng Sheng to appease them.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xuan succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 八年，伐紀，紀遷去其邑。

translations.literal: Eight years later, Qi attacked the state of Ji, forcing them to abandon their capital.
translations.idiomatic: He was ambitious.

sentences.zh: 十二年，初，襄公使連稱、管至父戍葵丘，瓜時而往，及瓜而代。

translations.literal: Twelve years later: initially, Duke Xiang sent Lian Cheng and Guan Zhi Fu to garrison Kui Qiu. They were to go at melon-planting time and be replaced at melon-harvesting time.
translations.idiomatic: He expanded Qi's territory.

sentences.zh: 往戍一歲，卒瓜時而公弗為發代。

translations.literal: They served a full year in garrison. When melon-harvesting time came, the duke failed to send replacements.
translations.idiomatic: They served a full year in garrison duty. When melon season arrived, the duke failed to send replacements.

sentences.zh: 或為請代，公弗許。

translations.literal: When they requested to be relieved, the duke refused.
translations.idiomatic: When they requested relief, the duke refused.

sentences.zh: 故此二人怒，因公孫無知謀作亂。

translations.literal: This angered the two men, who conspired with Gong Sun Wu Zhi to start a rebellion.
translations.idiomatic: Lian Cheng and Guan Zhi Fu became angry and, together with their troops, attacked and assassinated the duke along with Bing Yan, Bin Xu Wu, and Bing Xi in the palace at Kui Qiu.

sentences.zh: 連稱有從妹在公宮，無寵，使之閒襄公，曰「事成以女為無知夫人」。

translations.literal: Lian Cheng had a younger sister in the duke's palace, without favor, had her spy on Xiang Gong, said 'if the affair succeeds, I will make you Wu Zhi's wife.'
translations.idiomatic: Lian Cheng had a younger sister in the duke's harem who was out of favor. He had her spy on Duke Xiang and promised: 'If our plot succeeds, I'll make you Gong Sun Wu Zhi's wife.'

sentences.zh: 冬十二月，襄公游姑棼，遂獵沛丘。

translations.literal: In the twelfth month of winter, Duke Xiang visited Gufen and went hunting at Pei Qiu.
translations.idiomatic: The duke became angry and shot at it. The pig transformed into a person and stood wailing.

sentences.zh: 見彘，從者曰「彭生」。

translations.literal: Saw a pig, attendants said 'Peng Sheng.'
translations.idiomatic: He saw a pig, and his attendants exclaimed: 'It's Peng Sheng!'

sentences.zh: 公怒，射之，彘人立而啼。

translations.literal: The duke became furious and shot at it. The pig transformed into a person and stood wailing.
translations.idiomatic: Upon returning, he had Fu, the keeper of his shoes, whipped three hundred times.

sentences.zh: 公懼，墜車傷足，失屨。

translations.literal: Terrified, the duke fell from his carriage, injuring his foot and losing his shoe.
translations.idiomatic: The people of Qi killed Gong Sun Wu Zhi.

sentences.zh: 反而鞭主屨者茀三百。

translations.literal: Upon returning, he had Fu, the keeper of his shoes, whipped three hundred times.
translations.idiomatic: Zhu Er then fled from Lu to Qi, and the people of Qi established him as ruler, making him Duke Huan.

sentences.zh: 茀出宮。

translations.literal: Fu fled the palace.
translations.idiomatic: In the first year of Duke Huan, spring, Lord Wu Zhi was touring Yong Lin.

sentences.zh: 而無知、連稱、管至父等聞公傷，乃遂率其眾襲宮。

translations.literal: Wu Zhi, Lian Cheng, Guan Zhi Fu, and their accomplices learned of the duke's injury and immediately led their followers in an attack on the palace.
translations.idiomatic: A man from Yong Lin who had long harbored resentment against Wu Zhi attacked and killed him when he came to tour.

sentences.zh: 逢主屨茀，茀曰：「且無入驚宮，驚宮未易入也。」

translations.literal: Encountered the master of shoes Fu, Fu said: 'Do not enter yet and alarm the palace, alarming the palace is not easy to enter.'
translations.idiomatic: They encountered Fu, the keeper of the duke's shoes. Fu warned them: 'Don't rush in and alarm the palace—once alarmed, it won't be easy to enter.'

sentences.zh: 無知弗信，茀示之創，乃信之。

translations.literal: Wu Zhi was skeptical, but when Fu showed him his whip wounds, he believed the story.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huan welcomed him from Ju.

sentences.zh: 待宮外，令茀先入。

translations.literal: They waited outside the palace and sent Fu in first.
translations.idiomatic: Initially, when the Yong Lin man killed Wu Zhi, Duke Huan in his youth had often played with the Yong Lin man.

sentences.zh: 茀先入，即匿襄公戶閒。

translations.literal: Fu entered first and immediately concealed Duke Xiang behind the palace doors.
translations.idiomatic: His younger brother Xiao Bai fled to Ju, where Bao Shu served as his tutor.

sentences.zh: 良久，無知等恐，遂入宮。

translations.literal: After waiting a long time, Wu Zhi and his accomplices grew fearful and finally entered the palace.
translations.idiomatic: From a young age, Xiao Bai valued the words of worthy ministers and listened to Bao Shu.

sentences.zh: 茀反與宮中及公之幸臣攻無知等，不勝，皆死。

translations.literal: Fu turned and with the palace people and the duke's favored ministers attacked Wu Zhi and others, did not win, all died.
translations.idiomatic: Fu turned on them and, together with the palace guards and the duke's favorite ministers, fought Wu Zhi and his group. They were defeated and all killed.

sentences.zh: 無知入宮，求公不得。

translations.literal: Wu Zhi entered the palace but could not find the duke.
translations.idiomatic: Xiao Bai feared that Duke Huan would kill him, so he fled to Ju.

sentences.zh: 或見人足於戶閒，發視，乃襄公，遂弒之，而無知自立為齊君。

translations.literal: Some saw a person's feet between the door leaves, opened and looked, it was Xiang Gong, therefore assassinated him, and Wu Zhi established himself as Qi ruler.
translations.idiomatic: Someone noticed feet visible between the palace doors. They opened them and found Duke Xiang hidden there. They assassinated him, and Wu Zhi proclaimed himself ruler of Qi.

sentences.zh: 桓公元年春，齊君無知游於雍林。

translations.literal: In spring of the first year of Duke Huan's reign, the Qi ruler Wu Zhi went touring at Yong Lin.
translations.idiomatic: Shu Ya said: "Prince Jiu is my relative. If I don't kill him, I'll be disobeying orders."

sentences.zh: 雍林人嘗有怨無知，及其往游，雍林人襲殺無知，告齊大夫曰：「無知弒襄公自立，臣謹行誅。

translations.literal: Yong Lin people once had resentment toward Wu Zhi, and when he went touring, Yong Lin people suddenly killed Wu Zhi, told Qi grand officers saying: 'Wu Zhi assassinated Xiang Gong and established himself, your servant respectfully executed punishment.
translations.idiomatic: The people of Yong Lin had long harbored resentment toward Wu Zhi. When he came touring, they ambushed and killed him. They informed the Qi ministers: 'Wu Zhi assassinated Duke Xiang and usurped the throne. We have respectfully executed him.'

sentences.zh: 唯大夫更立公子之當立者，唯命是聽。」

translations.literal: Only grand officers change and establish the duke's son who should be established, only your command is obeyed.'
translations.idiomatic: Please install whichever of the duke's sons should rightfully rule—we will obey your command.'

sentences.zh: 初，襄公之醉殺魯桓公，通其夫人，殺誅數不當，淫於婦人，數欺大臣，群弟恐禍及，故次弟糾奔魯。

translations.literal: Initially, Xiang Gong's drunk killing of Lu Huan Gong, communicating with his wife, killing and punishing frequently improper, licentious with women, frequently deceiving ministers, the group of younger brothers feared calamity would reach them, therefore second younger brother Jiu fled to Lu.
translations.idiomatic: Originally: Duke Xiang had gotten drunk and killed Duke Huan of Lu, then had an affair with his wife. He executed people unjustly, was licentious with women, and frequently deceived his ministers. His younger brothers feared they would be next, so the second youngest, Prince Jiu, fled to Lu.

sentences.zh: 其母魯女也。

translations.literal: His mother was from the state of Lu.
translations.idiomatic: Your lordship should employ them.

sentences.zh: 管仲、召忽傅之。

translations.literal: Guan Zhong and Zhao Hu served as his tutors.
translations.idiomatic: Do not let the governance of the state fall into the hands of other clans."

sentences.zh: 次弟小白奔莒，鮑叔傅之。

translations.literal: The youngest brother, Prince Xiao Bai, fled to Ju, where Bao Shu served as his tutor.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huan said: "The feudal lords are encroaching on us. Can Qi remain secure?"

sentences.zh: 小白母，衛女也，有寵於釐公。

translations.literal: Xiao Bai's mother was a Wei woman, had favor with Xi Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Xiao Bai's mother was from Wei and was favored by Duke Xi.

sentences.zh: 小白自少好善大夫高傒。

translations.literal: From a young age, Xiao Bai admired and befriended the minister Gao Xi.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huan therefore followed his advice and entrusted governance to Gao Xi and Guo Zi.

sentences.zh: 及雍林人殺無知，議立君，高、國先陰召小白於莒。

translations.literal: After the Yong Lin people assassinated Wu Zhi, the ministers discussed who should be the new ruler. Gao Xi and Guo secretly summoned Xiao Bai from Ju first.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huan treated Guan Zhong with great courtesy, appointed him as minister, and entrusted him with governing the state.

sentences.zh: 魯聞無知死，亦發兵送公子糾，而使管仲別將兵遮莒道，射中小白帶鉤。

translations.literal: Lu heard Wu Zhi dead, also raised troops to send Prince Jiu, and had Guan Zhong separately lead troops to block the Ju road, shot and hit Xiao Bai's belt hook.
translations.idiomatic: When Lu learned of Wu Zhi's death, they also sent troops to escort Prince Jiu home. Guan Zhong led a separate force to ambush the road from Ju and shot Xiao Bai, hitting his belt buckle.

sentences.zh: 小白詳死，管仲使人馳報魯。

translations.literal: Xiao Bai pretended to be dead, and Guan Zhong sent messengers galloping back to Lu with the news.
translations.idiomatic: Upon returning from Ju, the people of Lu wanted to kill him, but Guan Zhong said: "No.

sentences.zh: 魯送糾者行益遲，六日至齊，則小白已入，高傒立之，是為桓公。

translations.literal: The Lu escort for Prince Jiu proceeded very slowly. By the time they reached Qi six days later, Xiao Bai had already arrived. Gao Xi installed him as ruler, and he became Duke Huan.
translations.idiomatic: This is a worthy prince of the world. Killing him would bring misfortune."

sentences.zh: 桓公之中鉤，詳死以誤管仲，已而載溫車中馳行，亦有高、國內應，故得先入立，發兵距魯。

translations.literal: Huan Gong's being hit by the hook, feigned death to mislead Guan Zhong, then loaded in warm carriage galloped away, also had Gao and Guo internal response, therefore could enter first and be established, raised troops to resist Lu.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huan had been hit by Guan Zhong's arrow, but he faked his death to deceive Guan Zhong. Then he was loaded into a warm carriage and raced away. He also had supporters among Gao Xi and Guo inside Qi, which allowed him to arrive first and claim the throne. He then raised troops to oppose Lu.

sentences.zh: 秋，與魯戰于乾時，魯兵敗走，齊兵掩絕魯歸道。

translations.literal: Autumn, fought with Lu at Gan Shi, Lu troops defeated and fled, Qi troops ambushed and cut off Lu's return road.
translations.idiomatic: In autumn, Qi fought Lu at Gan Shi. The Lu army was defeated and fled, while Qi troops ambushed and blocked their retreat.

sentences.zh: 齊遺魯書曰：「子糾兄弟，弗忍誅，請魯自殺之。

translations.literal: Qi sent Lu a letter saying: 'Zi Jiu is my brother, I cannot bear to execute him, please Lu kill him yourselves.
translations.idiomatic: Qi sent a letter to Lu: 'Prince Jiu is my brother—I cannot bear to execute him myself. Please have Lu kill him.'

sentences.zh: 召忽、管仲讎也，請得而甘心醢之。

translations.literal: Zhao Hu, Guan Zhong are enemies, please obtain them and satisfy the heart by mincing them.'
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Hu and Guan Zhong are my enemies. Please hand them over so I can take my revenge by having them minced.'

sentences.zh: 不然，將圍魯。」

translations.literal: If not, will besiege Lu.'
translations.idiomatic: Otherwise, I will besiege Lu.'

sentences.zh: 魯人患之，遂殺子糾于笙瀆。

translations.literal: The Lu leaders were alarmed and had Prince Jiu executed at Sheng Stream.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huan followed his advice and appointed Guan Zhong to govern.

sentences.zh: 召忽自殺，管仲請囚。

translations.literal: Zhao Hu committed suicide in loyalty to his prince, while Guan Zhong agreed to be imprisoned.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year, Qi conquered Tan, and the Lord of Tan fled to Ju.

sentences.zh: 桓公之立，發兵攻魯，心欲殺管仲。

translations.literal: After becoming duke, Huan Gong attacked Lu and harbored the desire to kill Guan Zhong.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, Duke Huan of Lu assassinated Duke Yin and established himself as ruler.

sentences.zh: 鮑叔牙曰：「臣幸得從君，君竟以立。

translations.literal: Bao Shu Ya said: 'Your servant fortunately got to follow you, you ultimately became established.
translations.idiomatic: Bao Shu Ya said: 'I was fortunate to serve you, and you have now become duke.

sentences.zh: 君之尊，臣無以增君。

translations.literal: Your lordship's honor, your servant has nothing to add to your lordship.
translations.idiomatic: Your position as duke is already secure—I cannot enhance it further.'

sentences.zh: 君將治齊，即高傒與叔牙足也。

translations.literal: If you simply want to rule Qi well, then Gao Xi and I are enough for the task.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year, Qi rescued Yan.

sentences.zh: 君且欲霸王，非管夷吾不可。

translations.literal: But if you aspire to become the hegemon king, then you absolutely need Guan Zhong.'
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year, Qi formed an alliance with Zheng at Ke.

sentences.zh: 夷吾所居國國重，不可失也。」

translations.literal: Yi Wu wherever he resides, state by state becomes important, cannot be lost.'
translations.idiomatic: Wherever Guan Zhong serves, that state becomes powerful. You cannot afford to lose such a talent.'

sentences.zh: 於是桓公從之。

translations.literal: Duke Huan accepted this advice.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, Qi attacked Wei and defeated the Wei army at Gui Di.

sentences.zh: 乃詳為召管仲欲甘心，實欲用之。

translations.literal: He pretended to summon Guan Zhong for execution, but actually intended to employ him.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, Qi attacked the Shan Rong.

sentences.zh: 管仲知之，故請往。

translations.literal: Guan Zhong understood the true intent and agreed to come.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh year, Zheng invaded Zhou. Zhou was afraid and appealed to Qi.

sentences.zh: 鮑叔牙迎受管仲，及堂阜而脫桎梏，齋祓而見桓公。

translations.literal: Bao Shu Ya went to receive Guan Zhong. When they reached Tang Hill, he removed Guan Zhong's shackles, had him purified, and presented him to Duke Huan.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, Qi attacked Zheng.

sentences.zh: 桓公厚禮以為大夫，任政。

translations.literal: Duke Huan received him with great honor, appointed him as minister, and entrusted him with governing the state.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirteenth year, Qi executed the Yong Lin man in the palace.

sentences.zh: 桓公既得管仲，與鮑叔、隰朋、高傒修齊國政，連五家之兵，設輕重魚鹽之利，以贍貧窮，祿賢能，齊人皆說。

translations.literal: Huan Gong having obtained Guan Zhong, with Bao Shu, Xi Peng, Gao Xi repaired Qi state governance, connected five families' troops, established light heavy fish salt profits, to support the poor, reward worthy and able, Qi people all were pleased.
translations.idiomatic: After gaining Guan Zhong, Duke Huan worked with Bao Shu, Xi Peng, and Gao Xi to reform Qi's government. They organized the military forces of five noble families, established monopolies on salt and fish to generate revenue, supported the poor, rewarded the worthy and talented, and all the people of Qi were content.

sentences.zh: 二年，伐滅郯，郯子奔莒。

translations.literal: In the second year, Qi conquered the state of Tan, and the Lord of Tan fled to Ju.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourteenth year, Qi rescued Xu.

sentences.zh: 初，桓公亡時，過郯，郯無禮，故伐之。

translations.literal: Originally, when Duke Huan was fleeing as a refugee, he passed through Tan and was treated discourteously, which is why he now attacked them.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifteenth year, Qi attacked Wei and defeated the Wei army at Zhuang.

sentences.zh: 五年，伐魯，魯將師敗。

translations.literal: In the fifth year, Qi attacked Lu and defeated their army.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, Qi attacked Lu and defeated the Lu army at Lang.

sentences.zh: 魯莊公請獻遂邑以平，桓公許，與魯會柯而盟。

translations.literal: Duke Zhuang of Lu offered to cede the city of Sui to make peace. Duke Huan agreed and met with Lu at Ke to conclude an alliance.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventeenth year, Qi formed an alliance at You.

sentences.zh: 魯將盟，曹沬以匕首劫桓公於壇上，曰：「反魯之侵地！」

translations.literal: Lu was about to ally, Cao Mo with dagger hijacked Huan Gong on the altar, said: 'Return Lu's invaded territory!'
translations.idiomatic: As the alliance ceremony was about to begin, Cao Mo held a dagger to Duke Huan on the altar platform and demanded: 'Return the territory you seized from Lu!'

sentences.zh: 桓公許之。

translations.literal: Duke Huan agreed.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighteenth year, Qi rescued Song.

sentences.zh: 已而曹沬去匕首，北面就臣位。

translations.literal: Cao Mo then put away his dagger, turned north to face the altar, and took his place as a minister.
translations.idiomatic: In the nineteenth year, Qi attacked Song.

sentences.zh: 桓公後悔，欲無與魯地而殺曹沬。

translations.literal: Duke Huan immediately regretted his promise and wanted to renege on returning the territory and kill Cao Mo.
translations.idiomatic: In the twentieth year, Qi attacked Lu and defeated the Lu army at Cheng.

sentences.zh: 管仲曰：「夫劫許之而倍信殺之，愈一小快耳，而棄信於諸侯，失天下之援，不可。」

translations.literal: Guan Zhong said: 'Being hijacked and permitted but then betraying trust and killing, is only a small satisfaction, but abandons trustworthiness among feudal lords, loses the world's support, cannot.'
translations.idiomatic: Guan Zhong said: 'Though you were coerced into agreeing, to go back on your word and kill him would only provide momentary satisfaction. But it would destroy your credibility among the feudal lords and forfeit the support of the entire world. That would be disastrous.'

sentences.zh: 於是遂與曹沬三敗所亡地於魯。

translations.literal: Duke Huan therefore honored his promise and returned to Lu three times the territory that had been lost.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-first year, Qi formed an alliance at Tao.

sentences.zh: 諸侯聞之，皆信齊而欲附焉。

translations.literal: When the other feudal lords heard of this, they all came to trust Qi and sought to ally with it.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-second year, Qi attacked Wei and defeated the Wei army at Xin Zhu.

sentences.zh: 七年，諸侯會桓公於甄，而桓公於是始霸焉。

translations.literal: In the seventh year, the feudal lords gathered to meet Duke Huan at Zhen, and this marked the beginning of his hegemony.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-third year, Qi attacked Ju.

sentences.zh: 十四年，陳厲公子完，號敬仲，來奔齊。

translations.literal: Fourteenth year, Chen Li Gong's son Wan, styled Jing Zhong, came fleeing to Qi.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourteenth year, Prince Wan of Chen (son of Duke Li of Chen), who was styled Jing Zhong, fled to Qi.

sentences.zh: 齊桓公欲以為卿，讓；

translations.literal: Qi Huan Gong wished to make him minister, declined;
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huan of Qi wanted to appoint him as a minister, but he politely declined.

sentences.zh: 於是以為工正。

translations.literal: So Duke Huan appointed him as Director of Works instead.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fourth year, Qi attacked Lu and defeated the Lu army at An.

sentences.zh: 田成子常之祖也。

translations.literal: Tian Cheng Zi Chang's ancestor.
translations.idiomatic: He was the ancestor of Tian Chengzi Chang.

sentences.zh: 二十三年，山戎伐燕，燕告急於齊。

translations.literal: In the twenty-third year, the Shanrong barbarians attacked Yan. Yan urgently appealed to Qi for help.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fifth year, Qi attacked Lu and defeated the Lu army at Qian Shi.

sentences.zh: 齊桓公救燕，遂伐山戎，至于孤竹而還。

translations.literal: Duke Huan of Qi went to Yan's aid and then attacked the Shanrong, advancing all the way to Gu Zhu before returning.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-sixth year, Qi formed an alliance with Song at Gou Du.

sentences.zh: 燕莊公遂送桓公入齊境。

translations.literal: Duke Zhuang of Yan then escorted Duke Huan all the way into Qi territory.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-seventh year, Qi attacked Xu.

sentences.zh: 桓公曰：「非天子，諸侯相送不出境，吾不可以無禮於燕。」

translations.literal: Huan Gong said: 'Not being Son of Heaven, feudal lords escorting each other do not go beyond the border, I cannot be discourteous to Yan.'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huan said: 'Only the Son of Heaven is escorted beyond borders by other rulers. I cannot treat Yan discourteously by letting them escort me further.'

sentences.zh: 於是分溝割燕君所至與燕，命燕君復修召公之政，納貢于周，如成康之時。

translations.literal: Therefore dug moat divided the Yan lord's reached place with Yan, commanded Yan lord again repair Zhao Gong's governance, submit tribute to Zhou, like Cheng Kang time.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huan therefore demarcated the territory with a ditch where the Yan lord had escorted him, and ordered the Yan lord to restore the governance of Duke Zhao and resume tribute payments to Zhou, just as in the time of Kings Cheng and Kang.

sentences.zh: 諸侯聞之，皆從齊。

translations.literal: When the other feudal lords heard of this, they all submitted to Qi's leadership.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-eighth year, Qi made peace with Chu.

sentences.zh: 二十七年，魯湣公母曰哀姜，桓公女弟也。

translations.literal: Twenty-seventh year, Lu Min Gong's mother called Ai Jiang, Huan Gong's younger sister.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-seventh year: the mother of Duke Min of Lu was named Ai Jiang, and she was Duke Huan's younger sister.

sentences.zh: 哀姜淫於魯公子慶父，慶父弒湣公，哀姜欲立慶父，魯人更立釐公。

translations.literal: Ai Jiang had an affair with Prince Qing Fu of Lu. Qing Fu assassinated Duke Min, and Ai Jiang wanted to install Qing Fu as ruler. But the Lu people instead installed Duke Xi.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-ninth year, Qi formed an alliance with Zheng at Ke.

sentences.zh: 桓公召哀姜，殺之。

translations.literal: Duke Huan summoned Ai Jiang and had her executed.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirtieth year, Qi attacked Lu and defeated the Lu army at Ge.

sentences.zh: 二十八年，衛文公有狄亂，告急於齊。

translations.literal: In the twenty-eighth year, Duke Wen of Wei suffered attacks from the Di barbarians and urgently appealed to Qi for help.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-first year, Qi formed an alliance with Chu at Shao Ling.

sentences.zh: 齊率諸侯城楚丘而立衛君。

translations.literal: Qi led the feudal lords in fortifying Chu Qiu and reinstalling the ruler of Wei.
translations.idiomatic: Qi led the feudal lords in fortifying Chu Qiu and reinstalling the ruler of Wei.

sentences.zh: 二十九年，桓公與夫人蔡姬戲船中。

translations.literal: In the twenty-ninth year, Duke Huan was amusing himself on a boat with his wife, Lady Cai Ji.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-ninth year, Duke Huan was amusing himself on a boat with his wife, Lady Cai Ji.

sentences.zh: 蔡姬習水，蕩公，公懼，止之，不止，出船，怒，歸蔡姬，弗絕。

translations.literal: Lady Cai, who was used to boating, rocked the boat violently. The duke became frightened and told her to stop, but she wouldn't. He left the boat in anger and sent her back to Cai, but did not divorce her.
translations.idiomatic: 蔡姬蕩公，公懼，出墮水。

sentences.zh: 蔡亦怒，嫁其女。

translations.literal: Cai was also angered and married off their daughter (to someone else).
translations.idiomatic: Lady Cai rocked the boat violently. The duke became frightened and jumped out, falling into the water.

sentences.zh: 桓公聞而怒，興師往伐。

translations.literal: When Duke Huan heard this, he became furious and launched a military campaign against Cai.
translations.idiomatic: 潛於水中，從者曰：「吾君何在？」

sentences.zh: 三十年春，齊桓公率諸侯伐蔡，蔡潰。

translations.literal: In spring of the thirtieth year, Duke Huan of Qi led the feudal lords in attacking Cai, and Cai was defeated.
translations.idiomatic: He hid underwater. His attendants asked: "Where is our lord?"

sentences.zh: 遂伐楚。

translations.literal: He then attacked Chu.
translations.idiomatic: 蔡姬曰：「何有吾君！」

sentences.zh: 楚成王興師問曰：「何故涉吾地？」

translations.literal: Chu Cheng Wang raised troops asked: 'Why invade my territory?'
translations.idiomatic: King Cheng of Chu mobilized his army and demanded: 'Why have you entered my territory?'

sentences.zh: 管仲對曰：「昔召康公命我先君太公曰：『五侯九伯，若實征之，以夾輔周室。』

translations.literal: Guan Zhong replied: 'Formerly Zhao Kang Gong commanded my ancestor Grand Duke saying: "Five marquises nine earls, you truly may punish them, to assist Zhou court on both sides."'
translations.idiomatic: Guan Zhong replied: 'In former times, Duke Zhao Kang commanded my ancestor the Grand Duke: "For the five marquises and nine earls, you may indeed punish them to support the Zhou court from both sides."'

sentences.zh: 賜我先君履，東至海，西至河，南至穆陵，北至無棣。

translations.literal: He granted my ancestor territory extending east to the sea, west to the Yellow River, south to Mu Ling, and north to Wu Di.'
translations.idiomatic: The duke peeked out and said: "I am here."

sentences.zh: 楚貢包茅不入，王祭不具，是以來責。

translations.literal: Chu has failed to submit its tribute of bundled thatch, leaving the king's sacrifices incomplete. That is why we have come to demand it.'
translations.idiomatic: 左右曰：「姦哉！」

sentences.zh: 昭王南征不復，是以來問。」

translations.literal: Zhao Wang south campaign not return, this comes to inquire.'
translations.idiomatic: King Zhao's southern expedition from which he never returned—that is what we have come to inquire about.'

sentences.zh: 楚王曰：「貢之不入，有之，寡人罪也，敢不共乎！

translations.literal: Chu Wang said: 'Tribute not entering, there is that, I the person crime, dare not supply!
translations.idiomatic: The Chu king said: 'As for the tribute not being submitted, that is indeed the case. I am guilty. How dare I not provide it!'

sentences.zh: 昭王之出不復，君其問之水濱。」

translations.literal: Zhao Wang's departure not return, my lord may ask it of the riverside.'
translations.idiomatic: As for King Zhao's expedition from which he never returned, your lordship may inquire of the river spirits.'

sentences.zh: 齊師進次于陘。

translations.literal: The Qi army advanced and camped at Xing.
translations.idiomatic: 三十年春，齊桓公欲封衞，燕人伐齊，齊桓公救燕，遂伐宋，因而封衞。

sentences.zh: 夏，楚王使屈完將兵捍齊，齊師退次召陵。

translations.literal: In summer, the Chu king sent Qu Wan to lead troops against Qi. The Qi army retreated and camped at Zhao Ling.
translations.idiomatic: In the spring of the thirtieth year, Duke Huan of Qi wanted to enfeoff land to Wei. The Yan people attacked Qi. Duke Huan rescued Yan, then attacked Song, and in the process enfeoffed land to Wei.

sentences.zh: 桓公矜屈完以其眾。

translations.literal: Duke Huan took pity on Qu Wan and his forces.
translations.idiomatic: 三十一年，齊桓公遷邢於夷儀，王命以為衛。

sentences.zh: 屈完曰：「君以道則可；

translations.literal: Qu Wan said: 'If my lord uses the Way, then it is acceptable;
translations.idiomatic: Qu Wan said: 'If your lordship acts according to proper principles, then it is acceptable.

sentences.zh: 若不，則楚方城以為城，江、漢以為溝，君安能進乎？」

translations.literal: if not, then Chu Fang Cheng as city, Jiang, Han as moat, my lord how can advance?'
translations.idiomatic: If not, then Chu will use Fang Cheng as its walls and the Jiang and Han rivers as its moat. How could your lordship advance?'

sentences.zh: 乃與屈完盟而去。

translations.literal: Duke Huan therefore concluded an alliance with Qu Wan and withdrew.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-second year, Duke Huan of Qi attacked the Shan Rong to rescue Yan, relocated Yan to Lin Hu, installed a ruler, and returned.

sentences.zh: 過陳，陳袁濤涂詐齊，令出東方，覺。

translations.literal: On the way back through Chen, Chen's minister Yuan Tao Tu tried to deceive Qi by ordering them to exit through the eastern gate, but the deception was discovered.
translations.idiomatic: 三十三年，齊桓公伐蔡，蔡潰，遂伐楚，次于陘。

sentences.zh: 秋，齊伐陳。

translations.literal: In autumn, Qi attacked Chen.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-third year, Duke Huan of Qi attacked Cai. Cai collapsed, so he attacked Chu, halting at Xing.

sentences.zh: 是歲，晉殺太子申生。

translations.literal: That same year, the state of Jin executed its crown prince Shen Sheng.
translations.idiomatic: 三十四年，齊桓公會諸侯於葵丘。

sentences.zh: 三十五年夏，會諸侯于葵丘。

translations.literal: In summer of the thirty-fifth year, Duke Huan assembled the feudal lords at Kui Qiu.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-fourth year, Duke Huan of Qi assembled the feudal lords at Kui Qiu.

sentences.zh: 周襄王使宰孔賜桓公文武胙、彤弓矢、大路，命無拜。

translations.literal: King Xiang of Zhou sent his prime minister Kong to grant Duke Huan the sacrificial meats of Kings Wen and Wu, a red bow and arrows, and a grand chariot, commanding that he need not bow in thanks.
translations.idiomatic: 三十五年，齊桓公會諸侯於葵丘，葵丘之會，諸侯來賀。

sentences.zh: 桓公欲許之，管仲曰「不可」，乃下拜受賜。

translations.literal: Huan Gong wished to permit it, Guan Zhong said 'cannot', therefore descended and bowed to receive the grant.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huan wanted to accept without bowing, but Guan Zhong said 'That cannot be done.' So Duke Huan descended from his dais, bowed, and received the gifts.

sentences.zh: 秋，復會諸侯於葵丘，益有驕色。

translations.literal: In autumn, he again assembled the feudal lords at Kui Qiu, and showed increasing signs of arrogance.
translations.idiomatic: 三十六年，齊桓公欲兵之會，兵車之會也。

sentences.zh: 周使宰孔會。

translations.literal: The Zhou court sent its prime minister Kong to attend the assembly.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-sixth year, Duke Huan of Qi wanted a military assembly - an assembly of armed forces.

sentences.zh: 諸侯頗有叛者。

translations.literal: Several of the feudal lords began to show signs of rebellion.
translations.idiomatic: 三十七年，齊桓公會諸侯於趙，立太子昭為君。

sentences.zh: 晉侯病，後，遇宰孔。

translations.literal: The Marquis of Jin fell ill. Later, he encountered Prime Minister Kong.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-seventh year, Duke Huan of Qi assembled the feudal lords at Zhao and installed Crown Prince Zhao as ruler.

sentences.zh: 宰孔曰：「齊侯驕矣，弟無行。」

translations.literal: Prime minister Kong said: 'Qi Hou arrogant now, younger brother no conduct.'
translations.idiomatic: Prime Minister Kong said: 'The Marquis of Qi has become arrogant. His younger brother has no moral standing.'

sentences.zh: 從之。

translations.literal: He heeded this advice.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-eighth year, Duke Huan of Qi assembled with Jin and Wei at Jian Tu.

sentences.zh: 是歲，晉獻公卒，裏克殺奚齊、卓子，秦穆公以夫人入公子夷吾為晉君。

translations.literal: That same year, Duke Xian of Jin died. Li Ke assassinated Xi Qi and Zhuo Zi. Duke Mu of Qin installed Prince Yi Wu as ruler of Jin, using his own daughter as the prince's wife.
translations.idiomatic: 三十九年，齊桓公會諸侯于葵丘。

sentences.zh: 桓公於是討晉亂，至高梁，使隰朋立晉君，還。

translations.literal: Duke Huan therefore intervened in Jin's disorder. He advanced to Gao Liang, had Xi Peng install a ruler for Jin, and then returned home.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-ninth year, Duke Huan of Qi assembled the feudal lords at Kui Qiu.

sentences.zh: 是時周室微，唯齊、楚、秦、晉為彊。

translations.literal: At this time, the Zhou royal house had grown weak. Only Qi, Chu, Qin, and Jin remained powerful.
translations.idiomatic: 四十一年，齊桓公卒。

sentences.zh: 晉初與會，獻公死，國內亂。

translations.literal: Jin had initially participated in the assemblies, but after Duke Xian's death, the state fell into internal disorder.
translations.idiomatic: In the forty-first year, Duke Huan of Qi died.

sentences.zh: 秦穆公辟遠，不與中國會盟。

translations.literal: Duke Mu of Qin kept his distance and did not participate in the assemblies of the central states.
translations.idiomatic: 易牙、豎刁、開方相與作亂，逐群公子，殺群公子。

sentences.zh: 楚成王初收荊蠻有之，夷狄自置。

translations.literal: King Cheng of Chu had recently conquered the Jing Man barbarians and incorporated their lands, establishing himself as a Yi Di power.
translations.idiomatic: Yi Ya, Shu Diao, and Kai Fang conspired together to create chaos. They drove out the various princes and killed the various princes.

sentences.zh: 唯獨齊為中國會盟，而桓公能宣其德，故諸侯賓會。

translations.literal: Only Qi consistently organized the assemblies of the central states. Duke Huan was able to demonstrate his virtue, so the feudal lords attended as honored guests.
translations.idiomatic: 公子昭奔宋。

sentences.zh: 於是桓公稱曰：「寡人南伐至召陵，望熊山；

translations.literal: Therefore Huan Gong declared: 'I the person south attacked reached Zhao Ling, gazed at Xiong Shan;
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huan then declared: 'I campaigned south as far as Zhao Ling and gazed upon Xiong Mountain;

sentences.zh: 北伐山戎、離枝、孤竹；

translations.literal: north attacked Shan Rong, Li Zhi, Gu Zhu;
translations.idiomatic: I campaigned north against the Shanrong, Li Zhi, and Gu Zhu;

sentences.zh: 西伐大夏，涉流沙；

translations.literal: west attacked Da Xia, crossed flowing sands;
translations.idiomatic: I campaigned west against Da Xia, crossing the flowing sands;

sentences.zh: 束馬懸車登太行，至卑耳山而還。

translations.literal: I bound my horses and suspended my chariots to climb Mount Taihang, reaching Mount Bei'er before returning.
translations.idiomatic: 宋襄公率諸侯伐齊，南至楚丘，以王命討之。

sentences.zh: 諸侯莫違寡人。

translations.literal: None of the feudal lords have defied me.
translations.idiomatic: 齊孝公立。

sentences.zh: 寡人兵車之會三，乘車之會六，九合諸侯，一匡天下。

translations.literal: I have held three assemblies with war chariots and six with carriages. I have united the feudal lords nine times and rectified the world once.'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xiao of Qi was established.

sentences.zh: 昔三代受命，有何以異於此乎？

translations.literal: Former three dynasties received mandate, had what different from this?
translations.idiomatic: How do the Three Dynasties of old receiving the mandate differ from this?'

sentences.zh: 吾欲封泰山，禪梁父。」

translations.literal: I wish feng Tai Shan, chan Liang Fu.'
translations.idiomatic: I wish to perform the feng sacrifice on Mount Tai and the chan sacrifice at Liang Fu.'

sentences.zh: 管仲固諫，不聽；

translations.literal: Guan Zhong firmly advised, did not listen;
translations.idiomatic: Guan Zhong strongly advised against it, but Duke Huan would not listen.

sentences.zh: 乃說桓公以遠方珍怪物至乃得封，桓公乃止。

translations.literal: So Guan Zhong persuaded Duke Huan that the precious and strange objects from distant lands must arrive before the feng sacrifice could be performed. Duke Huan then abandoned the idea.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year, the feudal lords fortified Chu Qiu.

sentences.zh: 三十八年，周襄王弟帶與戎、翟合謀伐周，齊使管仲平戎於周。

translations.literal: In the thirty-eighth year, Prince Dai (younger brother of King Xiang of Zhou) conspired with the Rong and Di barbarians to attack Zhou. Qi sent Guan Zhong to pacify the Rong barbarians on Zhou's behalf.
translations.idiomatic: 三年，齊孝公請諸侯城邢。

sentences.zh: 周欲以上卿禮管仲，管仲頓首曰：「臣陪臣，安敢！」

translations.literal: Zhou wished with upper minister ceremony Guan Zhong, Guan Zhong knocked head said: 'Subject attendant minister, how dare!'
translations.idiomatic: Zhou wished to receive Guan Zhong with the ceremony due an upper minister. Guan Zhong bowed his head to the ground and said: 'I am but a minister of a minister—how dare I accept such honor!'

sentences.zh: 三讓，乃受下卿禮以見。

translations.literal: After declining three times, he finally accepted the ceremony appropriate for a lower minister and was presented to the king.
translations.idiomatic: 四年，諸侯城邯鄲。

sentences.zh: 三十九年，周襄王弟帶來奔齊。

translations.literal: In the thirty-ninth year, Prince Dai (younger brother of King Xiang of Zhou) fled to Qi.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, the feudal lords fortified Han Dan.

sentences.zh: 齊使仲孫請王，為帶謝。

translations.literal: Qi sent Zhong Sun to petition the king and apologize on Dai's behalf.
translations.idiomatic: 五年，齊孝公卒，子昭公潘立。

sentences.zh: 襄王怒，弗聽。

translations.literal: King Xiang was furious and refused to listen.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth year, Duke Xiao of Qi died, and his son Duke Zhao Pan ascended.

sentences.zh: 四十一年，秦穆公虜晉惠公，復歸之。

translations.literal: In the forty-first year, Duke Mu of Qin captured Duke Hui of Jin but then released him.
translations.idiomatic: 昭公之元年，七月，宋襄公及楚人伐齊，齊師敗績，獲齊侯。

sentences.zh: 是歲，管仲、隰朋皆卒。

translations.literal: That same year, both Guan Zhong and Xi Peng died.
translations.idiomatic: In the first year of Duke Zhao, seventh month, Duke Xiang of Song and the Chu people attacked Qi. The Qi army suffered defeat, and the Marquis of Qi was captured.

sentences.zh: 管仲病，桓公問曰：「群臣誰可相者？」

translations.literal: Guan Zhong ill, Huan Gong asked: 'Among the ministers who can be chancellor?'
translations.idiomatic: Guan Zhong fell ill. Duke Huan asked him: 'Which of my ministers is suitable to serve as chancellor?'

sentences.zh: 管仲曰：「知臣莫如君。」

translations.literal: Guan Zhong said: 'Know ministers none like lord.'
translations.idiomatic: Guan Zhong replied: 'No one knows your ministers better than you do, my lord.'

sentences.zh: 公曰：「易牙如何？」

translations.literal: Gong said: 'Yi Ya how?'
translations.idiomatic: The duke asked: 'What about Yi Ya?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「殺子以適君，非人情，不可。」

translations.literal: Replied: 'Killed son to please lord, not human feeling, cannot.'
translations.idiomatic: Guan Zhong replied: 'He cooked his own son to please you. That's unnatural and unacceptable.'

sentences.zh: 公曰：「開方如何？」

translations.literal: Gong said: 'Kai Fang how?'
translations.idiomatic: The duke asked: 'What about Kai Fang?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「倍親以適君，非人情，難近。」

translations.literal: Replied: 'Abandoned parents to please lord, not human feeling, difficult to approach.'
translations.idiomatic: Guan Zhong replied: 'He abandoned his parents to please you. That's unnatural and makes him dangerous to be around.'

sentences.zh: 公曰：「豎刀如何？」

translations.literal: Gong said: 'Shu Dao how?'
translations.idiomatic: The duke asked: 'What about Shu Dao?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「自宮以適君，非人情，難親。」

translations.literal: Replied: 'Self-castrated to please lord, not human feeling, difficult to be close to.'
translations.idiomatic: Guan Zhong replied: 'He castrated himself to please you. That's unnatural and makes him dangerously untrustworthy.'

sentences.zh: 管仲死，而桓公不用管仲言，卒近用三子，三子專權。

translations.literal: Guan Zhong died, and Huan Gong did not use Guan Zhong's words, finally approached and used three sons, three sons monopolized power.
translations.idiomatic: After Guan Zhong's death, Duke Huan ignored his advice and grew close to these three treacherous favorites, allowing them to monopolize power.

sentences.zh: 四十二年，戎伐周，周告急於齊，齊令諸侯各發卒戍周。

translations.literal: In the forty-second year, the Rong barbarians attacked Zhou. Zhou urgently appealed to Qi, which ordered all the feudal lords to send troops to defend Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: 懿公之二年，春，宋伐齊，至衛。

sentences.zh: 是歲，晉公子重耳來，桓公妻之。

translations.literal: This year, Jin prince Chong Er came, Huan Gong married him [to a daughter].
translations.idiomatic: That same year, Prince Chong Er of Jin arrived, and Duke Huan gave him one of his daughters in marriage.

sentences.zh: 四十三年。

translations.literal: In the forty-third year:
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, Song attacked Qi. The Qi army suffered defeat, and the people of Qi killed Duke Yi.

sentences.zh: 初，齊桓公之夫人三：曰王姬、徐姬、蔡姬，皆無子。

translations.literal: Initially, Qi Huan Gong's wives three: called Wang Ji, Xu Ji, Cai Ji, all had no sons.
translations.idiomatic: Originally, Duke Huan of Qi had three principal wives: Lady Wang, Lady Xu, and Lady Cai, but none had borne him sons.

sentences.zh: 桓公好內，多內寵，如夫人者六人，長衛姬，生無詭；

translations.literal: Huan Gong fond of women, many inner favorites, like wives six people, elder Wei Ji, gave birth Wu Gui;
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huan was enamored with women and had many favorites in his harem. He had six concubines of wife-like status. The eldest, Lady Wei, bore him Wu Gui;

sentences.zh: 少衛姬，生惠公元；

translations.literal: younger Wei Ji, gave birth Hui Gong Yuan;
translations.idiomatic: the younger Lady Wei bore him Hui Gong Yuan;

sentences.zh: 鄭姬，生孝公昭；

translations.literal: Zheng Ji, gave birth Xiao Gong Zhao;
translations.idiomatic: Lady Zheng bore him Xiao Gong Zhao;

sentences.zh: 葛嬴，生昭公潘；

translations.literal: Ge Ying, gave birth Zhao Gong Pan;
translations.idiomatic: Lady Ge bore him Zhao Gong Pan;

sentences.zh: 密姬，生懿公商人；

translations.literal: Mi Ji, gave birth Yi Gong Shang Ren;
translations.idiomatic: Lady Mi bore him Yi Gong Shang Ren;

sentences.zh: 宋華子，生公子雍。

translations.literal: Lady Hua of Song bore him Prince Yong.
translations.idiomatic: 齊人共立惠公之子元，是為頃公。

sentences.zh: 桓公與管仲屬孝公於宋襄公，以為太子。

translations.literal: Duke Huan and Guan Zhong entrusted Duke Xiao to Duke Xiang of Song as a hostage, designating him as crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: The people of Qi together established Duke Hui's son Yuan as Duke Qing.

sentences.zh: 雍巫有寵於衛共姬，因宦者豎刀以厚獻於桓公，亦有寵，桓公許之立無詭。

translations.literal: The shaman Yong Wu was favored by Lady Wei. Through the eunuch Shu Dao, he made lavish gifts to Duke Huan and gained his favor. Duke Huan agreed to establish Wu Gui as heir.
translations.idiomatic: 頃公之元年，宋伐齊，齊人殺頃公。

sentences.zh: 管仲卒，五公子皆求立。

translations.literal: After Guan Zhong's death, all five of Duke Huan's sons vied for the throne.
translations.idiomatic: In the first year of Duke Qing, Song attacked Qi, and the people of Qi killed Duke Qing.

sentences.zh: 冬十月乙亥，齊桓公卒。

translations.literal: On the yi hai day of the tenth month in winter, Duke Huan of Qi died.
translations.idiomatic: 齊人共立頃公之子無野，是為靈公。

sentences.zh: 易牙入，與豎刀因內寵殺群吏，而立公子無詭為君。

translations.literal: Yi Ya entered the palace and, together with Shu Dao, used the harem favorites to kill the chief officials and install Prince Wu Gui as ruler.
translations.idiomatic: The people of Qi together established Duke Qing's son Wu Ye as Duke Ling.

sentences.zh: 太子昭奔宋。

translations.literal: Crown Prince Zhao fled to the state of Song.
translations.idiomatic: 靈公之元年，宋伐齊，齊人殺靈公。

sentences.zh: 桓公病，五公子各樹黨爭立。

translations.literal: While Duke Huan lay ill, his five sons each built factions and fought to be named heir.
translations.idiomatic: While Duke Huan lay ill, his five sons each built factions and fought to be named heir.

sentences.zh: 及桓公卒，遂相攻，以故宮中空，莫敢棺。

translations.literal: After Duke Huan's death, the factions attacked each other. The palace was deserted, and no one dared to prepare his coffin.
translations.idiomatic: After Duke Huan's death, the factions attacked each other. The palace was deserted, and no one dared to prepare his coffin.

sentences.zh: 桓公尸在床上六十七日，尸蟲出于戶。

translations.literal: Huan Gong's corpse on bed sixty-seven days, corpse worms came out the door.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huan's body lay on the bed for sixty-seven days, with maggots crawling out through the door.

sentences.zh: 十二月乙亥，無詭立，乃棺赴。

translations.literal: On the yi hai day of the twelfth month, Wu Gui was installed as duke. Only then was the body coffined and the funeral procession begun.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huan's corpse lay on the bed for sixty-seven days, with corpse worms crawling out through the doorway.

sentences.zh: 辛巳夜，斂殯。

translations.literal: That night (xin si), the body was dressed and placed in the coffin.
translations.idiomatic: On the yi hai day of the twelfth month, at night, Duke Huan rose from his corpse and lay down with Yi Ya's head as his pillow.

sentences.zh: 桓公十有餘子，要其後立者五人：無詭立三月死，無謚；

translations.literal: Huan Gong ten plus sons, summarizing those later established five people: Wu Gui established three months died, no posthumous name;
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huan had more than ten sons. In summary, five of them later became rulers: Wu Gui ruled for three months and died without a posthumous title;

sentences.zh: 次孝公；

translations.literal: next Xiao Gong;
translations.idiomatic: next Duke Xiao;

sentences.zh: 次昭公；

translations.literal: next Zhao Gong;
translations.idiomatic: next Duke Zhao;

sentences.zh: 次懿公；

translations.literal: next Yi Gong;
translations.idiomatic: next Duke Yi;

sentences.zh: 次惠公。

translations.literal: next Duke Hui.
translations.idiomatic: 桓公病而亂作，國人分散，六嬖各將其黨宮中而戰。

sentences.zh: 孝公元年三月，宋襄公率諸侯兵送齊太子昭而伐齊。

translations.literal: In the third month of Duke Xiao's first year, Duke Xiang of Song led the troops of the feudal lords to escort Prince Zhao of Qi and attack Qi.
translations.idiomatic: When Duke Huan fell ill and chaos erupted, the people scattered. The six favored concubines each led their factions and fought in the palace.

sentences.zh: 齊人恐，殺其君無詭。

translations.literal: The people of Qi, in fear, assassinated their ruler Wu Gui.
translations.idiomatic: 宋雍巫有寵於衛共姬，因宦者豎刀以厚獻于桓公，亦有寵，桓公許之立無詭。

sentences.zh: 齊人將立太子昭，四公子之徒攻太子，太子走宋，宋遂與齊人四公子戰。

translations.literal: Qi people about to establish crown prince Zhao, four princes' followers attacked crown prince, crown prince fled Song, Song then with Qi people's four princes fought.
translations.idiomatic: As the people of Qi were about to install Crown Prince Zhao, the followers of the four other princes attacked him. Zhao fled to Song, and Song then fought against the four Qi princes.

sentences.zh: 五月，宋敗齊四公子師而立太子昭，是為齊孝公。

translations.literal: In the fifth month, Song defeated the army of the four Qi princes and installed Crown Prince Zhao as ruler, who became Duke Xiao of Qi.
translations.idiomatic: 雍巫遂偵齊亂，便殺群公子。

sentences.zh: 宋以桓公與管仲屬之太子，故來征之。

translations.literal: Song acted because Duke Huan and Guan Zhong had entrusted Prince Zhao to Duke Xiang as crown prince, so they came to enforce this.
translations.idiomatic: Yong Wu therefore watched for the chaos in Qi and took advantage to kill all the princes.

sentences.zh: 以亂故，八月乃葬齊桓公。

translations.literal: Due to the disorder, Duke Huan of Qi was not buried until the eighth month.
translations.idiomatic: 已殺孝公、潘父，獨殺公子無詭、公子雍及公孫婼、公孫強。

sentences.zh: 六年春，齊伐宋，以其不同盟于齊也。

translations.literal: In spring of the sixth year, Qi attacked Song because Song had not allied with Qi.
translations.idiomatic: He had already killed Duke Xiao and Pan Fu, but spared Prince Wu Gui, Prince Yong, and the grandsons Jiao and Qiang.

sentences.zh: 夏，宋襄公卒。

translations.literal: In summer, Duke Xiang of Song died.
translations.idiomatic: 雍巫曰：「同母者，歸之；不同母者，殺之。」

sentences.zh: 七年，晉文公立。

translations.literal: In the seventh year, Duke Wen of Jin ascended the throne.
translations.idiomatic: Yong Wu said: "Those of the same mother, send them away; those of different mothers, kill them."

sentences.zh: 十年，孝公卒，孝公弟潘因衛公子開方殺孝公子而立潘，是為昭公。

translations.literal: Tenth year, Xiao Gong died, Xiao Gong's younger brother Pan relied on Wei prince Kai Fang killed Xiao Gong's son and established Pan, this was Zhao Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, Duke Xiao died. His younger brother Pan, with the help of Prince Kai Fang of Wei, assassinated Duke Xiao's son and installed Pan as ruler, who became Duke Zhao.

sentences.zh: 昭公，桓公子也，其母曰葛嬴。

translations.literal: Zhao Gong, Huan Gong's son, his mother called Ge Ying.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Zhao was a son of Duke Huan, and his mother was named Lady Ge.

sentences.zh: 昭公元年，晉文公敗楚於城濮，而會諸侯踐土，朝周，天子使晉稱伯。

translations.literal: In Duke Zhao's first year, Duke Wen of Jin defeated Chu at the Battle of Chengpu, assembled the feudal lords at Jiantu, paid homage to the Zhou court, and the Son of Heaven granted Jin the title of overlord.
translations.idiomatic: 雍巫立無詭之子為君，是為襄王。

sentences.zh: 六年，翟侵齊。

translations.literal: In the sixth year, the Di barbarians invaded Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Yong Wu established Wu Gui's son as ruler, making him King Xiang.

sentences.zh: 晉文公卒。

translations.literal: Duke Wen of Jin died.
translations.idiomatic: 襄王元年，宋襄公率諸侯伐齊，齊師敗績，獲齊侯。

sentences.zh: 秦兵敗於殽。

translations.literal: Qin forces were defeated at the Battle of Xiao.
translations.idiomatic: In the first year of King Xiang, Duke Xiang of Song led the feudal lords to attack Qi. The Qi army suffered defeat, and the Marquis of Qi was captured.

sentences.zh: 十二年，秦穆公卒。

translations.literal: In the twelfth year, Duke Mu of Qin died.
translations.idiomatic: 宋以衞公子買為質，齊求其赦。

sentences.zh: 十九年五月，昭公卒，子舍立為齊君。

translations.literal: In the fifth month of the nineteenth year, Duke Zhao died and his son She was installed as ruler of Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Song held Prince Mai of Wei as hostage, and Qi sought his release.

sentences.zh: 捨之母無寵於昭公，國人莫畏。

translations.literal: She's mother had no favor with Zhao Gong, state people none feared.
translations.idiomatic: She's mother had no favor with Duke Zhao, so the people of the state had no respect for him.

sentences.zh: 昭公之弟商人以桓公死爭立而不得，陰交賢士，附愛百姓，百姓說。

translations.literal: Zhao Gong's younger brother Shang Ren because Huan Gong death contended for establishment but did not obtain, secretly befriended worthy scholars, attached and loved the common people, common people pleased.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Zhao's younger brother Shang Ren had vied for the throne after Duke Huan's death but failed. He secretly cultivated relationships with worthy scholars and endeared himself to the common people, who were pleased with him.

sentences.zh: 及昭公卒，子舍立，孤弱，即與眾十月即墓上弒齊君舍，而商人自立，是為懿公。

translations.literal: After Duke Zhao's death, his son She was installed as ruler, but he was isolated and weak. In the tenth month, Shang Ren led a crowd to assassinate Duke She on his father's tomb and installed himself as ruler, becoming Duke Yi.
translations.idiomatic: 齊人共立宋雍巫之弟為君，是為惠王。

sentences.zh: 懿公，桓公子也，其母曰密姬。

translations.literal: Yi Gong, Huan Gong's son, his mother called Mi Ji.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Yi was a son of Duke Huan, and his mother was named Lady Mi.

sentences.zh: 懿公四年春，初，懿公為公子時，與丙戎之父獵，爭獲不勝，及即位，斷丙戎父足，而使丙戎仆。

translations.literal: Yi Gong fourth year spring, initially, Yi Gong as prince time, with Bing Rong's father hunted, contended for catch not win, and when ascended throne, cut off Bing Rong's father feet, and made Bing Rong serve.
translations.idiomatic: In spring of Duke Yi's fourth year: originally, when Duke Yi was still a prince, he hunted with Bing Rong's father and lost a contest over a catch. After becoming duke, he had Bing Rong's father mutilated by cutting off his feet, and forced Bing Rong to serve as his attendant.

sentences.zh: 庸職之妻好，公內之宮，使庸職驂乘。

translations.literal: Yong Zhi's wife beautiful, duke took her into palace, made Yong Zhi serve as secondary charioteer.
translations.idiomatic: Yong Zhi's wife was beautiful, so the duke took her into his palace and made Yong Zhi serve as his secondary charioteer.

sentences.zh: 五月，懿公游於申池，二人浴，戲。

translations.literal: In the fifth month, Duke Yi went touring at Shen Pool. The two men bathed there and played around.
translations.idiomatic: 二年，宋伐齊，齊人殺惠王。

sentences.zh: 職曰：「斷足子！」

translations.literal: Zhi said: 'Cut feet son!'
translations.idiomatic: Yong Zhi said: 'You son who cut off feet!'

sentences.zh: 戎曰：「奪妻者！」

translations.literal: Rong said: 'Seize wife person!'
translations.idiomatic: Bing Rong said: 'You who seized my wife!'

sentences.zh: 二人俱病此言，乃怨。

translations.literal: Both men were enraged by these words and harbored deep resentment.
translations.idiomatic: The people of Qi together established Song Yong Wu's son as ruler, making him King Qing.

sentences.zh: 謀與公游竹中，二人弒懿公車上，棄竹中而亡去。

translations.literal: They conspired to accompany the duke on a tour of the bamboo grove. The two men assassinated Duke Yi right on his carriage, abandoned his body in the bamboo grove, and fled.
translations.idiomatic: 頃王元年，宋伐齊，齊人殺頃王。

sentences.zh: 懿公之立，驕，民不附。

translations.literal: Yi Gong's establishment, arrogant, people not attached.
translations.idiomatic: During Duke Yi's reign, he was arrogant and the people did not support him.

sentences.zh: 齊人廢其子而迎公子元於衛，立之，是為惠公。

translations.literal: The people of Qi deposed Duke Yi's son and went to Wei to welcome Prince Yuan, installing him as ruler, who became Duke Hui.
translations.idiomatic: 齊人共立宋雍巫之弟為君，是為靈王。

sentences.zh: 惠公，桓公子也。

translations.literal: Hui Gong, Huan Gong's son.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Hui was a son of Duke Huan.

sentences.zh: 其母衛女，曰少衛姬，避齊亂，故在衛。

translations.literal: His mother was a woman from Wei, called Younger Lady Wei. She had fled to Wei to avoid the chaos in Qi.
translations.idiomatic: 靈王元年，宋伐齊，齊人殺靈王。

sentences.zh: 惠公二年，長翟來，王子城父攻殺之，埋之於北門。

translations.literal: In Duke Hui's second year, the Changdi barbarians came. Wang Zi Cheng Fu attacked and killed them, burying the bodies at the north gate.
translations.idiomatic: In the first year of King Ling, Song attacked Qi, and the people of Qi killed King Ling.

sentences.zh: 晉趙穿弒其君靈公。

translations.literal: Zhao Chuan of Jin assassinated his ruler Duke Ling.
translations.idiomatic: 齊人共立宋雍巫之子為君，是為莊王。

sentences.zh: 十年，惠公卒，子頃公無野立。

translations.literal: In the tenth year, Duke Hui died and his son Duke Qing (Wu Ye) succeeded him.
translations.idiomatic: The people of Qi together established Song Yong Wu's son as ruler, making him King Zhuang.

sentences.zh: 初，崔杼有寵於惠公，惠公卒，高、國畏其偪也，逐之，崔杼奔衛。

translations.literal: Originally, Cui Zhu was favored by Duke Hui. After Duke Hui's death, Gao Xi and Guo feared Cui Zhu's overbearing influence and drove him out. Cui Zhu fled to Wei.
translations.idiomatic: 莊王元年，宋伐齊，齊人殺莊王。

sentences.zh: 頃公元年，楚莊王彊，伐陳；

translations.literal: Qing Gong first year, Chu Zhuang Wang strong, attacked Chen;
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Qing's first year, King Zhuang of Chu was powerful and attacked Chen;

sentences.zh: 二年，圍鄭，鄭伯降，已復國鄭伯。
